dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'm not. And no, I don't play the saxophone. But that's just it. Not everything matches. Help me. Please.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I'm not a psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I don't want to see a psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can dig up, and I can speak to Agatha if you like, but, as far ag you are concerned... the book back.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Finish it. A cake's true flavor cannot be ascertained while still in the bowl. If, after reading it in its entirety you still believe its subject to be you, then whoever wrote it knows you very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Mortimer studies Walter. She smiles, takes a PEN from her now full pencil-holder mug.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ALICE MORTIMER
dialogues.text: Five days' emotional leave never hurt anyone.  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha decorates a cake in the shape of a KEY.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Emotional leave?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: A whole week! Can you believe it? I can't get over how easy it was to fool her.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Walter, you lied to her.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I had to ensure my job wouldn't be jeopardized.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: But you've never lied before.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I've never had to. Listen to me, Ag, I'm Unit 5. Five! Five is simply 2 plus 3. Isaac's words, exactly.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Isaac said that to you?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He was wearing a yellow tie. Yellow is 92, or four 23s. Dr. Mortimer? She has a mug on her desk which she uses as a pencil holder. It was empty last time yet this time there were 23 pencils in it. Every time I look at the clock-- He glances at a clock on the wall. It's 11:21 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: 21. Not 23. And no, it's not slow.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: 1 and 1 plus 21 is 23. 11 times 2 plus 1 is 23. 11 plus 21 is 32 and you know what 32 is!

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Walter, what's happening to you? You're insane! What's happened to the fun-loving, dog-catching man I love?  58.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'm still a dogcatcher, Ag. (a beat) How many cakes are in this room?

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: I don't know. Lots. A beat. Agatha counts the cakes on display. The 'key' mak

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Twenty three.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I need to do this, Ag. For us.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Fine. Stay home and read the damn thing. The quicker you finish it, the quicker ‚Äòus' can get back to normal. Walter kisses her and leaves. Agatha picks up a PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nestles in his armchair. Takes a deep breath. Read

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "The nightmare wasn't an isolated incident.‚Äù

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling and Fabrizia are asleep.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ‚ÄúOver the next few days I couldn't decide what was worse. Being asleep." Fingerling bolts upright.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: "Or being awake." He checks the time -- 02:30 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling cuddles Fabrizia from behind as she prepares breakfast. Suddenly he reaches for a knife and slits her throat...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "Sometimes it was impossible to tell the difference."  59. ...before Fabrizia twists around in his grasp and feeds h a spoonful of yogurt, waking him from his macabre trance.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: "Pabrizia began to resent my sudden sharing of her favorite word.‚Äù Fabrizia finishes a head-count and looks at Fingerling.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERLING
dialogues.text: See? It's bi-zarre.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "She adopted a new word. Or rather, a phrase."

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIA
dialogues.text: You are so in-sane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks up. Thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUT
dialogues.text: He dismisses it. Continues.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "Occasionally she added a word..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrizia lies on the floor, naked, naughty bits obscured WHIPPED CREAM, Fingerling is atop her, examining the whip cream easy-squeeze bottle.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIA
dialogues.text: You are so FUCKING in-sane. Stop counting the calories and fuck me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant studies Fingerling's phone.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: "My Sergeant notices subtle changes in my behavior." All the numbers have been SCRATCHED OFF the buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling is with his Sergeant.  60.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: "He decides I need heip."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling browses while the intellectually dashing DR. M PHOENIX takes notes.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERLING
dialogues.text: "Suicide Gal's name was Isobel Lydia Hunt. 62, 51, 63, reducible to 8, 6, 9. Twenty three."

dialogues.speaker: DR. MILES PHOENIX
dialogues.text: What do you think that means? Fingerling gazes out the window. Everywhere he looks 2s a 3gs_seem to sparkle, like stars at night.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERLING
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant stares at a GUN and BADGE on his desk. He tu to the window, sees Fingerling clearing his desk.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "The wise Dr. Phoenix recommends I take a break. Like time is gonna heal me. All time is is a counting system. Numbers with meaning attached to them. Still, a break is what the good doctor prescribed. He called it--"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pauses.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: --emotional leave?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: "Fabrizia was not impressed." Fingerling hangs up his uniform. Fabrizia is in bed.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIA
dialogues.text: So you're not a cop anymore?  61.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERLING
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm still a cop. Just a cop on holiday.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIA
dialogues.text: Without a gun.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERLING
dialogues.text: I still have these. He holds up his HANDCUFFS and gets into bed.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIA
dialogues.text: Let's just get some sleep tonight. She kisses him on the cheek, rolls over and kills the lig

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "She didn't understand." In the dark, the digital alarm clock clicks to 00:23.

dialogues.speaker: INT, FINGERLING AND FABRIZIA'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Fingerling sits in his robe staring blankly at a wall, a notepad in his lap. Words and numbers fill the page.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "Which was fine, because neither did zr." Fabrizia enters, ready for work. She rips off the top pag and tears it up. The page below shows more of the same. S tears that up, too. The whole pad is full. She tears up the whole pad and leaves for work.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. SUICIDE GAL'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Suicide Gal stares at the French doors ~- still open.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "All I knew was, the number had gone after Suicide Gal."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She races towards them... out onto the BALCONY... and off flying like a bird without wings... SIDEWALK looming...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "And now it was coming after me."  62. Fingerling, dry and in a towel, stares at the SHOWERHEAD fear. He backs out, into the BEDROOM, stumbling to the fl in front of FABRIZIA'S OPEN CLOSET. He counts her SHOES. 22 pairs. And one empty space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling stands in the middle of the street. Wherever he looks he sees the number: on license plates, shop windows, hidden in door numbers, graffitied on walls man at a phone booth punches 2-3-2-3-2... it's EVERYWHERE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrizia is CHOPPING onions for what would be spaghetti bolognaise. Fingerling is in an armchair, secretly tearing page 23 fr books. The CHOPPING NOISE stops.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell? He quickly shuts the book, thinking he's been rumbled.

dialogues.speaker: FABRIZIA
dialogues.text: What are these doing in the trash? She holds up a PAIR OF HER SHOES, now covered in vegetabl scraps. She picks up a saucepan, walks over to Fingerling, and em the contents (tomato sauce) over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Phoenix looks at a PHOTO of Fabrizia.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MILES PHOENIX
dialogues.text: I can speak to her if you like. Fingerling lifts his head out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "I believe he said it in total innocence at the time.‚Äù

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling watches a COFFEE SHOP opposite. THROUGH THE WINDOW, we see Fabrizia chatting to Dr. Phoen She walks to the rear of the shop. He follows.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling climbs onto a TOILET SEAT and peers into the N CUBICLE, where Fabrizia and Dr. Phoenix are kissing.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "Yes, at the time I believe he said it in total innocence. But looking back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Phoenix looks at a photo of Fabrizia, says (MOS) "I c speak to her if you like.‚Äù Fingerling lifts his head.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: ...I wish I'd reacted differently."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a SCREAM... pedestrians glance about... then... Dr. Phoenix HITS the sidewalk, shards of glass raining do seconds later -- the remnants of his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling looks at Dr. Phoenix opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "I should have realized the truth. I know it's absurd, but, even the color of his tie betrayed him." Dr. Phoenix wears a yellow tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter‚Äôs mouth falls open. FLASHCUT: ISAAC IN HIS YELLOW TIE. Walter freezes. Looks back at the book, checking a previo passage.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: "I can speak...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUT
dialogues.text: Walter paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at the PHOTOS on the mantelpiece. The one o the end is of Agatha and Isaac. He grabs the phone. Dials It RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Come on, come on. The phone just RINGS and RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks along, muttering quietly, trying to convince himself of something not being true. He passes LIP-LOCKED LOVERS in a doorway. Stares at them, bizarrely transfixed. A sign in a LAWYER'S WINDOW reads "DIVORCES FROM $230." Next, he sees a FUNERAL HOME. Walter starts to run, pushing his way through the crowds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter runs up. The shop is dark. A sign says, "CLOSED FO

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: She doesn't close for lunch. Besides it's... He looks at a CLOCK DIAL on the building opposite. It cli to 3:23. He backs away. Freezes. His eyes are transfixed an APPROACHING BUS. Zt! Ni 2 He backs away, into A HARDWARE STORE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-and waits just inside the door until the bus passes.

dialogues.speaker: HARDWARE STORE OWNER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How can I help you? Her voice makes Walter jump. He turns, sees a WOMAN behin the counter. He approaches. She's writing a PRICE LABEL. Walter stares at it: "ONE WEEK ONLY: $23."

dialogues.speaker: HARDWARE STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: Hello? Anyone home?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Is there a... a coffee shop nearby?  65.

dialogues.speaker: HARDWARE STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: Why yes, there's one on the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter exits. As he passes the WINDOW he freezes. The woman hangs the label on a BUTCHER'S KNIFE. Walter runs to the STREET CORNER. The COFFEE SHOP is acro the road. He freezes, crestfallen. THROUGH THE WINDOW, we see Agatha speaking to Isaac. Agatha heads into the rear of the shop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits on a bench, zombie-like. Isaac enters a TALL BUILDING in the distance. Walter rise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter goes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac looks up as Walter enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the tall building's windows SHATTER. Isaac flies o He SCREAMS, arms flailing, HITS the sidewalk with a THUD.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: still sitting on the bench, staring at the sidewalk, fist clenched, a mischievous smile on his face -- ng dead Isaa in_sight. He awakes from his macabre trance. Unfurls his fists in s His hands begin to shake. He flees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter comes home. Enters the LIVING ROOM. Stares at the walls. He goes into the KITCHEN, splashes his face with w His eyes are drawn to the KNIFE BLOCK.  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter opens Agatha‚Äôs closet. Stares at her shoes. Counts them. There are...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Twenty two. ...plus the one empty space he points to as he says:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Twenty three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes a sheet of paper and attempts to write "DEAR AGATHA." His hand TREMBLES so much the words are ILLEGIBL He rolls a sheet of paper into the old typewriter. Freeze The numbers 2 and 3 are worn off their keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hurries down with a SMALL SUITCASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a BADLY WRITTEN ENVELOPE for "AGATHA" on the tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter comes out.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Walter? She turns up the path. Sees the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Walter? Walter walks up to her and kisses her passionately.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I love you. You know that. He throws his case in the truck and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha is reading Walter's note. There are tears in her e  67.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ...A long time ago we made some vows. I meant every one of them. That's why I have to do this. It's just one night. Please don't try to find me. Please don't give up on me. Your - loving, dogcatching husband, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter scours the streets for a place to stay. Every hote he passes has a "NO VACANCY" sign up. He pulls over, frustrated. Suddenly, he drives off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's truck is outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLERK looks at a key rack on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL CLERK
dialogues.text: Room 27 is the quietest. It's all the way at the back, no one will disturb you there. Walter sees a key hanging from 23.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What about 23?

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL CLERK
dialogues.text: 23 wouldn't behoove your desires. It's next to the bathroom and we're experiencing problems with the water system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter unlocks Room 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are SODDEN. Walter opens his case. It contains TOILETRY BAG and a few CLOTHES, but otherwise is full of PHOTOS of Agatha_and Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Agatha and Robin push the food around their plates.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photos are all on display. Walter sits in the chair b the bureau. He opens "The Number 23." Reads its disclaime

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: "All the characters in this book are fictitious, and anyone finding a resemblance to actual persons, living or dead, should proceed no further.‚Äù He turns to the front cover. Determined:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: ‚ÄòI have news for you, Mr. Kretts, you sonofabitch. He finds where he left off.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The rest of the book was as I feared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrizia, all dressed-up, examines discarded cartons and boxes (of milk, juice, various foodstuffs, etc.) in the t TINY HOLES have been cut into them, removing all the numb She opens the fridge. All the food and liquids are in LIT BAGGIES. She picks up what is probably milk. The bag BURS open all over her,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrizia yells at Fingerling. He takes it -~- meek and gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling scribbles on the once-clean walis. He looks up as Fabrizia exits the bedroom in a long leath coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling peeks out from behind a tree. HIS POV: the tree stands on THE FRINGE OF A PARK and twen odd yards away, Fabrizia, her coat spread open, is staked the ground under the moonlight as Dr. Phoenix ravishes he  69. INT. FINGERLING AND FABRIZIA‚ÄòS APARTMENT ~ MORNING Fingerling opens Fabrizia's closets and drawers -- all em He runs into the LIVING ROOM, scans the place. It looks different -- it's lost that woman‚Äôs touch. He sees Fabrizia's ENGAGEMENT RING on the KITCHEN COUNTER beside a newspaper dated NOVEMBER 23RD. He tears a NOTE o the fridge: "DEAR FINGERLING, GOODBYE...‚Äù

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling plays the sax. Tears stream down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling stares at Fabrizia's letter. He starts mumblin to himself and crosses out letters. First go all the Ws.. He stops. Nearly all the letters have been crossed out. T ones that remain spell: "KILL HER."

dialogues.speaker: INT, HARDWARE STORE
dialogues.text: Fabrizia and Dr. Phoenix buy a BUTCHER'S KNIFE. Fingerlin spies on them through an aisle's shelves. They leave, LAUGHING. Fingerling emerges. Walks to a disp Sees THE KNIFE, a special offer at $23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrizia is in bed, eyes closed with wrists tied to the p and a sheet over her body. A MAN IN A SKI MASK enters. He straddles her, slowly peels back the sheet. He freezes for her torso is BLOODY. He tugs off his mask -- Dr. Phoe Behind him, Fingerling creeps out of the closet with a KN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling awakes from a NIGHTMARE. He stares at the empt bed beside him. Turns to his reflection in the mirror. Hu the sax at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling teeters on the edge... but isn't brave enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant is on the phone. Fingerling enters. He mouth the words, "HELP ME."

dialogues.speaker: INT, COURTROOM
dialogues.text: The Sergeant dips his head as a JURY FOREMAN announces th "GUILTY" verdict. Fingerling mouths the words ‚ÄúTHANK YOU" to the JURORS the turns to the JUDGE. As the Judge sentences him, Fingerlin jaw drops in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUS passes through the main gates, Fingerling's frantic face squashed up against the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling paces about, his fingers curling and uncurling frenzied fashion, as if counting. He SCREAMS, runs into a wall, headbutting it. He bounces back unhurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerling drops to his knees and, hands clasped together pleads with his DOCTOR. The Doctor takes pity, slides a JOURNAL and PENCIL across the table. Fingerling grabs it, thankful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor runs in. Fingerling, calm and at peace with th world, lies on the floor, DEAD. A POOL OF BLOOD SEEPS FRO HIS HEAD, THE PENCIL EMBEDDED DEEP INTO HIS SKULL.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It wasn't the happiest of endings. The journal, now titled "THE NUMBER 23," lies beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns to the last page.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not by a long shot. The final word is "END" and written below each letter is value: E=5, N=14, D=4. 5+14+4=23.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Unlike Fingerling, the number survived to live another day. Walter closes the book. Moves to the window. Stares at th graveyard across the street. His reflection is ODDLY BLUR  71.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Or rather, to kill another day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned stares up at Walter. He draws the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter gazes at his home down the street.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER UP
dialogues.text: Robin exits in his school uniform. He heads in the opposi direction. A CAR passes him, pulls up outside the house. Isaa¬¢ gets out. Knocks on the door. Agatha answers. She's still in her nightgown. She invites him in. Off Walter's look of despair we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter creeps in. The LIVING ROOM is empty. He stares up staircase. Goes into the KITCHEN. Grabs a BUTCHER'S KNIFE studies his REFLECTION in the blade. Shit, for a second h looked just like... But now he's turned and is heading UPSTAIRS. He strides t the BEDROOM when a NOISE comes from the BATHROOM -- the s of WATER MOVEMENT followed by a LOUD GASP FOR AIR. He pau

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Again. Walter THROWS open the bathroom door, revealing... Isaag_and Agatha in the bath together, Isaac holding Agat under_the water. Walter raises the knife and we CUT BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, imitating his nightmare, pummels his steering whe with downward strokes. He slows. Catches sight of himself in the mirror -- craze inhuman. Not himself. He starts to cry.  72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter trudges along, aimless. He stops. Stares at his reflection in a TAROT PARLOR window. He's FINGERLING. He rubs his eyes. Looks again. He's WALTER. The TAROT READER opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: TAROT READER
dialogues.text: Tell you your future for twenty dollars?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What if I already know it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Located in a quaint, COBBLESTONED street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits quietly while SERGEANT CROMWELL J. BURNS: stu the book.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT BURNS
dialogues.text: Mr. Sparrow, I can't arrest you for a crime you haven't committed, especially one you fear you'll commit because of a book.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It's not just a book.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT BURNS
dialogues.text: Yes. So you've said. (sighs; a beat) Know why I have these stripes?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You're the Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT BURNS
dialogues.text: Know why some cops make Sergeant and others don't? They're good with people. Good at knowing people, being able to read them. I look at you and I don't see a killer. I see a man whose only crime is he loves his wife too much. I suffer from the same condition. He points to a PHOTO OF HIS WIFE on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT BURNS
dialogues.text: Go back to her.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands on the steps, looking up and down the stree He sees a PHONE BOOTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha sits quietly. She's been crying. Isaac is still he

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I was trying to help. All I did was drive him away.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: He is coming back.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: T know. I know. (looks her in the eye) Only a fool wouldn't. He moves behind her and gently rubs her back.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I‚Äôm your friend.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: I know, but, if he knew... The phone RINGS. Agatha answers it.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Hello? Walter?

dialogues.speaker: EXT, STREET
dialogues.text: Walter listens into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Walter, is this you? Walter, talk to me! Walter opens his mouth to speak when he hears:

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (muted) Let me try. Walter sinks his head. When he looks up, everywhere he tu 2s_and 3s SEEM TO SPARKLE, like stars at night. He drops the phone. Flees.  74. INT. ‚ÄúTHE _HELL" HOTEL - DAY Walter, hot and sweaty, bursts through the doors, heads t the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YMCA-style, a long line of basins opposite showers. Walter splashes water on his face. Stares into the mirror His focus shifts to the showers behind. He approaches one FLASHCUT: FINGERLING STARES AT THE SHOWERHEAD IN FEAR. Walter counts the holes in a showerhead.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: {nearing the end) ...66, 67, 68... The shower SPITS OUT WATER at him with a HISS. Walter YEL staggers back, stumbles to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter presses the door shut and leans his head against t wood. Something off to one side draws his eye. The wallpa is peeling away, the ol aper visible underneath. "23" is ETCHED INTO IT.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The number had gone after Fingerling. He stares at the room. Suddenly, a long, sodden strip of wallpaper on the bathroom-facing wall peels away revealin MASS OF SCRIBBLES AND NUMBERS.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And now it was coming after me. Another strip of paper PEELS AWAY. And another. And anoth Walter grabs the door handle, CRAZED SCRIBBLES AND THE NU 23 appearing all around him. The door STICKS. He tugs it again and again, until finall it flies off its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter races to the ELEVATOR. Hits the button. Floor ligh 2 and 3 flash continuously. He panics, has trouble breath sees the STAIRWELL.  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter crashes out. Inhales deeply. He moves to the edge, stares at the world around him, fin some connection to 23 everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Why? Why me? What have I done to deserve this? Suddenly he pauses. He is dangerously close to the edge.. yet that's not why he has paused. He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: A DOG
dialogues.text: sits on the CHURCH STEPS far below. It's staring at him. EXT. "THE _HELL‚Äù HOTEL - DAY Walter exits. The dog hasn't moved. It has black, bottoml eyes and a silver collar.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Ned? Ned GROWLS. -

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You sonofabitch. This is all your fault. If you hadn't made me late... He takes his TRANQUILIZER GUN from his truck. Loads it. W towards Ned. Aims. Just before he can fire, Ned bolts int the graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh no you don't. This time you don't get away. Walter holds up his hand and steps into the road, forcing car to SQUEAL to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter follows Ned down row after row of graves -- the sa direction as before. Our POV shifts to behind walter, as someone follows him. Ned disappears around the other side of THE GRAVE. Walter inches up. Peers over the top. Ned is sitting on t GRAVE, He HOWLS.  76.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Now, now. Don‚Äôt cry. Just you rest... in... PEACE! He FIRES! The dart sticks into Ned's chest, takes immedia effect, and he falls asleep. Walter looks at LAURA TOLLINS' grave. She lived from "FEB 9, 19-- to FEBRUARY 10, 19--" (23 years later).

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh that's just fucking poetic. Dead at 23. {kicks Ned) You Nasty Evil... Dog. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: N-E-D? Twenty three. He stares at Ned ~~ bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ned? An old priest, FATHER SEBASTIAN, stands at the end of the aisle. He brushes past Walter and kneels beside Ned.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I trust there's an explanation for this?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Is this your dog?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: He belongs to Barnaby, my gardener.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Where is he? I want to speak to him.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I see. How's your sign language?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: fireman-style, as he follows Father Sebastian across the graveyard.  77.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: No one knows quite how he lost it. Some say he cut it out himself. They walk towards a MAN trimming the grass around a grave with a pair of SCISSORS. This is BARNABY.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Barnaby? You have a visitor. Barnaby rises. Not only does he have NO TONGUE, but also LAZY EYE. He is the SILHOUETTE and decidedly more siniste looking up close.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Is he... harmless?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. He also understands everything you say. Barnaby takes Ned from Walter's shoulders and strokes him

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Don't go getting all teary-eyed over him. He bit me the other day. Barnaby pauses on hearing 'BIT.'

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Bit you? But Ned's a sweetheart, never bitten a soul before.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Then what's this? He rolls up his sleeve revealing the BITE MARK.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: And what's that? He points at Barnaby {who is staring at him) and A BITE M on his arm -- albeit, long-since healed.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Sparrow, if your intention is to sue the church, I warn you, God makes a formidable foe.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I want answers. Ask him if the number 23 means anything to him.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: As I said, he understands what you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Barnaby) What does the number 23 mean to you? 78. Barnaby continues to stare, then suddenly, moves his hand

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What did that mean?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: He says you must have done something to provoke Ned for him to bite you.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I stuck my arm out. Now answer my question. What does the number 23 mean to you? Barnaby moves his hands again.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: He says, without it, the world would be in big trouble.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What does he-- what do you mean by that? Father Sebastian continues to translate (throughout scene

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: How would we get to twenty four without it?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Funny guy, huh? Listen pal, I could have this mysterious little pet of yours destroyed, just like that. He clicks his fingers. A smile creeps over Barnaby‚Äôs face the very idea.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Why'd you name him Ned?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: He didn't. Ned was a stray when he took him in.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He wears a collar.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Yes, he does.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Where did you find him?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Right here. He likes graveyards. {not signed) That's certainly true. Ned accompanies me whenever I perform a funeral. He's quite well-known amongst my fellow clergymen, often goes walkabout to their graveyards. He sits and stares at the stones, like he's watching over them. That's how he got his nickname -~ 'The Guardian of the Dead.' Off Walter's look we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: LAURA TOLLINS' GRAVE
dialogues.text: and Walter, gazing at it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: February 10? That's in three days' time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter approaches a LIBRARIAN.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Do you keep old newspapers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGE DUSTY TOMES surround Walter. He searches through OLD NEWSPAPERS. Suddenly, his jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha and Robin sit in silence. Agatha gazes at the mantelpiece -- clear of photos. Isaac enters with two cof HEADLIGHTS suddenly shine through the curtains as a CAR p into their driveway.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha follows Robin from the LIVING ROOM. He flings open the FRONT DOOR and Walter enters, clutching a bundle of PHOTOCOPIES. Robin hugs him. Walter locks eyes with Agath  80.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'm not insane. It's not just a number. It screws with your head and gets you to kill the one you love. It's true. It's all-- Isaac appears in the LIVING ROOM doorway.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: --true. Agatha turns to Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Perhaps you should be going.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No. I want him to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sparrows plus Isaac sit at the table. Walter holds up PHOTOCOPY. OF A NEWSPAPER ARTICLE. A headline reads: "23- OLD STUDENT MISSING, FEARED DEAD" with a PICTURE of a wom identified as: "LAURA TOLLINS.‚Äù

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Her body's never been found but her bed was soaked in so much blood... This is the man who killed her. He holds up another PHOTOCOPY with the headline "LAURA'S PROFESSOR DID IT" and a PICTURE of a man, "KYLE FLINCH."

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Kyle Flinch. The police found the murder weapon -- a butcher's knife -- in a nearby dumpster. It had his prints all over it. Another PHOTOCOPY reads: "PROFESSOR'S PRINTS 'ALL OVER' B STAINED KNIFE." Agatha studies it.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Walter, this happened years ago.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Ag, the police discovered he wasn't just her English professor. They were lovers. He told them Laura liked to have her wrists tied to the bedposts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter points to a HIGHLIGHTED PASSAGE in one of the arti

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: How she liked to fool around in parks at night.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Said it was her idea to buy the knife, she wanted to role-play an attack. He pled innocent but the jury saw through that little ruse and the Judge locked him up forever. Remember what Fingerling does in confinement?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Kyle Flinch is Topsy Kretts. The book is a kind of warped confession.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: A dog told you this?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Ned's not just a dog. He's 'The Guardian of the Dead.' Silence, until:

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Why'd he write it about you? Why would you want to hurt mom? Walter looks at Agatha... and Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha stands by the window, the book in her hands. Walte at her side.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Do you remember the name of the bookstore? FLASHCUT: WALTER APPROACHES THE BOOKSTORE, "A NOVEL FATE.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: There's something I haven‚Äôt told you. I didn't want to... make things worse. {a beat} I didn't choose the book.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It chose you. Agatha gazes at the stars.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: In a few hours the sun will rise. Flowers will open. Birds will sing. People will wake up and eat breakfast. Children will wait eagerly in front of TV sets for the cartoons they know are going to be on... 82.

dialogues.speaker: IN FRONT OF
dialogues.text: She turns around to find Walter staring at her shoes in t closet -- all 23 pairs.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: You are not going to kill me, Walter. You could never harm me, Never. That, I know. Walter looks her straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: How do you know? A beat. He takes a BLANKET and PILLOW from a closet and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter lies on the couch, watching the clock go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha lies in bed, alone. Her cheeks are moist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: exits. round. Walter sleeps. The clock clicks to 02:29. Walter's eyes o He rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at the knife block in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: INT, STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: Walter goes up, something shiny in hands.  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter climbs onto the bed. Raises the KNIFE in the air. Waiting. The alarm clock clicks to 02:30. He brings the k down. Again. And again.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Walter? He turns to the door. A light comes on. Agatha stands the

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Walter looks at the bedcovers. SHREDDED. BLOOD seeping through. He pulls them back. More blood. Lots. But _NO BO cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER AWAKES
dialogues.text: and he is still on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light comes on. Walter stares at the knife block -- Q KNIFE IS MISSING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha stares into space. Suddenly she freezes. The bedro door is opening slowly. Walter enters. Agatha shuts her eyes, tight. Walter tiptoes to the bed. Reaches out. Touches Agatha. S with relief -- she's alive. He leaves. Agatha's eyes open. She sits up, her hands coming out fro under the covers. She grips a KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER UP
dialogues.text: Walter sits with Agatha and Robin.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Please?

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: No. We shouldn't even have brought you.  84.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Then can I read the book while you're gone?

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Your dad needs the book, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin watches from the truck as Walter and Agatha walk to a DRAB, INTIMIDATING BUILDING. Agatha stares at the approaching high walls, covered in B WIRE. She slows, hands shaking, forehead perspiring -- it like the walls are closing in on her.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: I can't do this. I'm sorry. I just can't.

dialogues.speaker: INT, PRISON
dialogues.text: KYLE FLINCH sits on the wrong side of the perspex screen toying with a CROSSWORD. He looks up as Walter approaches They study each other, then, just as Walter is about to s

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: You're two days early. A stunned beat.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You... you knew I would come?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: You always come. (off Walter's look) Not today, certainly not tomorrow -- tomorrow's a ‚Äòhappy' day -- but on the 10th... yes, I always have visitors on the 10th.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: The day you killed the woman you loved.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: The day she was taken from me.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You like playing with words?  85.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: Words don't judge you. They depend on you. Much the same as... a dog and its master. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Numbers aren't as much fun to play with, are they?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: A mathematician might disagree. (a beat) I don‚Äôt recall you having come before. Usually my visitors are full of bitterness, though they try to hide it to appease me.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Perhaps I'm different? Because I'm two days early?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: You're the bird and I'm the worm? Sorry, but, I still can't help you. Just as I couldn't help them.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: How many 'visitors' have you had?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: I've stopped counting. Like you said, numbers aren't much fun.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'm gonna beat it. The number. I want you to know that. Walter puts the BOOK on the counter. Flinch studies it, t puzzled, turns his eye on Walter.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: You aren't family, your skin tone‚Äôs not oily enough. Yet, you don‚Äôt seem a friend, either. Which leaves me wondering... just who you are?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You can stop the games. I know you know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: I have plenty of time for games, Mr--  86. A beat, until Walter concedes. He waits. He rises.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: --Mr. Sparrow, all the time in the world. But believe me, this isn‚Äôt a particularly nice place to spend the night, so I suggest you ask me the question, I give you my answer, and then we can both be on our way.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Okay. Why did you write it?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: (with a strange smile) I'll give you ten out of ten for amusement value. (a beat) The correct question, usually said with a quavering lower lip and tears in the eyes, is, "Where's her body?" The answer is, has always been, "I do not know because I did not kill her." As for who wrote that, I have no idea. I must admit, I'm vaguely interested as to why you think it was I, but only vaguely. It was nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mr. Kretts. Or I'll prove to the world that you did kill Laura. He puts the VARIOUS NEWSPAPER COPIES beside the book. Fli stares at them, his eyes tearing up, reliving the horror.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I know this is a warped confession. But I don't give a shit that you killed your loved one. All I care about is how you know so much about me? Why did you choose me? What is this 23 phenomenon? Because it‚Äôs not coming true, I promise you. I don't care how weak and spineless you were, itm stronger. I WILL BEAT THE NUMBER. Flinch stares at him, incredulous. He sits back down.  87.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: Do you want to know the worst thing about my being in prison? My family -- my sister, my parents -- they came to visit. FLASHCUT: KYLE‚ÄôS PARENTS AND SISTER SIT ACROSS FROM HIM I THE CUBICLE.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: Over time the visits got less. My sister stopped coming. FLASHCUT: KYLE'S PARENTS SIT ACROSS FROM HIM.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: I noticed my mother wouldn't look me in the eye. Soon she stopped coming. FLASHCUT: KYLE'S FATHER SITS ACROSS FROM HIM.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: Eventually my father told me my sister committed suicide, unable to deal with having a murderer for a brother. There were tears in his eyes when he said it, but they were tinged with anger, not sadness. FLASHCUT: KYLE'S FATHER RISES. WALKS AWAY FROM HIS SON.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: That was the last time I saw him. {a beat) I didn't get death, Mr. Sparrow, and they're never letting me out, but somehow, I think your problems are greater than mine so I shall give you the only advice I can. I didn't kill Laura. I loved her. That's the truth, for I have no reason to lie to you. I didn't write that book. Now, unless I can help you with anything else... Walter stares into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What's your middle name?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Jacob, Walter nods. Collects his stuff. Rises. And walks away.  88.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: Mr. Sparrow? Walter pauses.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: Suppose I were to write a book? I'd choose a better name than 'Top Secrets.' A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide-eyed Robin sits in the back tracing a finger over name "TOPSY KRETTS.‚Äù

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: She was killed with his knife. Police found it in a dumpster with his prints and her blood all over it. He had blood on his hands when he called 911.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He's innocent. I know he is.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: How do you know? Walter passes her a pad with "KYLE JACOB FLINCH" on it. S reveal his name equals 19.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: The killer framed him, Ag. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: If the book's about a girl's murder, and the man the police said did it, didn't do it, then...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: The killer's still out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN stands by a window, his back to us. He is on the ph He hangs up. Turns around. It is Isaac.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha hangs up the PHONE by the FRONT DOOR. She enters t LIVING ROOM, where Walter and Robin sit in silence. The B is on the coffee table. Agatha takes a seat. Everyone stares at the walls.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Can we sit in the kitchen? The Sparrows head into the KITCHEN (Robin takes the book with him). They sit in silence around the kitchen table, Robin reading the BLURBS on the back of the book. Walter rises, pours himself some milk. He stares at the m FOTY motif. Empties the milk down the sink.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I have to find him. (off Agatha's look) I have to. If this bastard framed Kyle Flinch for Laura Tollins‚Äô murder, who‚Äôs to say he's not planning to... He can't say it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: She died February 10th. Less than 48 hours away. Robin flicks through the book, sees the MAILBOX ADDRESS i the back cover.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I know how we can find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Agatha watch a MAIL FACILITY across the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin walks up to the CLERK at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm thinking of getting a box and was wondering what the deal is?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Parents don't like you getting porn at home, do they? Nine-ninety-five a month, payable in advance.  90.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Is it a problem if something comes that‚Äôs over-size?

dialogues.speaker: INT, BOX COMPANY
dialogues.text: Walter, Agatha, and Robin watch as a CONFUSED CLERK fills HUGE BOX with PLASTIC SNOW.

dialogues.speaker: CONFUSED CLERK
dialogues.text: Sure you don't want anything in it?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Just the snow. The Clerk shrugs and seals the box. Robin hands him a lab for "TOPSY KRETTS..."

dialogues.speaker: CONFUSED CLERK
dialogues.text: When do you want it to get there?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: CONFUSED CLERK
dialogues.text: It'll have to go Fedex.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: CONFUSED CLERK
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: No. We want a hundred of them.

dialogues.speaker: CONFUSED CLERK
dialogues.text: You what? Agatha hands him a credit card. A clock CHIMES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun sets, the moon appears, and the city shuts down f the night. The chiming continues into sunrise. One last c (the seventh) and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIVING ROOM clock shows 7 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER UP
dialogues.text: Walter stares into the HALLWAY MIRROR, nervously trying t perfect his tie.  91. Agatha stares into the BATHROOM mirror. She exits, passes Walter, and heads DOWNSTAIRS to the KITCHEN where she col her HANDBAG. Her eyes fall on the knife block. It's FULL. Robin fusses with his tie in his BEDROOM mirror. He slips PENKNIFE into a pocket and takes one last look at his roo Walter and Robin enter the KITCHEN. Agatha takes Robin's hand and walks him to the front door. Walter checks the back door is locked. On leaving the kit he pauses. There's an EMPTY SLOT in the knife block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's truck pulls up across the street. A CAR (hereaft known as 'THE MYSTERY CAR‚Äô) pulls up a few cars behind th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sparrows sit and wait. Agatha is a bundle of nerves.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: He might not be the author. He could be his agent... his publisher... he might not even have met the man. It might not even be a man.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We'll know soon enough. He points to a FEDEX VAN. The FEDEX GUY enters the mail facility, exiting a few sec later with the Clerk. He opens the back of his van. The C is not pleased. The Fedex Guy shrugs and begins unloading The Clerk storms back inside, picks up the PHONE. Walter beams proudly at Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing what a hundred, over-size boxes will do to a plac The Clerk fumes behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: INT, TRUCK
dialogues.text: The Sparrows watch people enter and leave the facility, b to the car that parks in front of them. An OLD MAN gets out. He crosses over and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Man rummages through one of the boxes.  92.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You won't find anything in it. He turns around. Walter, Agatha, and Robin are in the doo

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: {to Robin) Hey, I remember you. The Old Man stares at Walter. He holds up the book.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We meet at last, 'Topsy Kretts.'

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: No. This cannot be. The Old Man clutches his heart and staggers backwards, fa against the boxes. They slide apart under his weight. SNO flies everywhere. He slumps to the floor. Agatha's the first to react. She inches forward, kneels o him.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Is he...

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Go outside. GO OUTSIDE! But Robin, like his father, is frozen to the spot. Agatha begin CPR. After a few breaths, she looks up at the Clerk

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Call an ambulance. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha and Robin sit in silence. Walter stares into an OPERATING ROOM where DOCTORS work frantically to save the Old Man. Things look grim. Walter RAPS on the door and SHOUTS:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Don't you die on me, old man. You hear me? Don't you die! {to the Doctors) He was alive when we brought him in. Alive! Don't you dare kill him. A NURSE exits.  93.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, but, I'm going to have to ask you to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Ask away. My future, my wife's very life, depends on that man. YOU CAN'T

dialogues.speaker: LET HIM DIE
dialogues.text: The Nurse tries to lead him away.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Get off me! He yanks himself free. A SECURITY GUARD approaches. Agath too.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Walter? Honey? I think you should take Robin home. Walter calms suddenly. He turns to Robin -- staring blank into space.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: He shouldn't be here. Walter glances back at the Old Man.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: I'll stay. I'll call you as soon as I hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sparrows walk to the truck. Agatha kisses Robin, then Walter.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHING WALTER
dialogues.text: from inside THE MYSTERY CAR across the street. Or are we watching Agatha? She turns and heads back to the hospital

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha approaches the Operating Room. It's empty. She tur to a passing NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Where's the old man who was in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha gazes at the Old Man, in bed and hooked up to a LI SUPPORT MACHINE. Suddenly his eyes open. He stares at Agatha. Raises his h Beckons her to him. Agatha, cautious, approaches the bed, The Old Man urges h closer, wanting to tell her something. She leans over him her ear above his mouth. He's about to whisper something. ...when his life-support machine FLAT-LINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter drives in silence. In the back seat, Robin stares into space, eyes glassy. We enter them...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUT
dialogues.text: Robin awakes from his trance. Pulls a PAD from his pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha watches as the Old Man is taken from the room, a S over his head. She turns to a DOCTOR beside her.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry. He walks away. Agatha just stands there. She looks down at her hands. Sh holds the 01d Man's PERSONAL BELONGINGS. On top is a WALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pulls into the Sparrow driveway. Kills the ignitio Turns to Robin.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You okay? Robin nods. Walter opens his door.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Dad? Who chose my name? You or Mom?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I did. Why?  95.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: No reason. Walter gets out. Robin stares at the pad. On it is written: "ROBIN WILBERF SPARROW" and some numbers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha, clutching her bag, paces back and forth at the bo of A STEEP FLIGHT OF STEPS. She stops. Stares at the step

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND.
dialogues.text: Agatha opens her bag. Navigating the KNIFE, she pulls out the Old Man's WALLET. Flipping it open, we see it belongs a "DR. SIRIUS LEARY." She looks up the steps at a tall, grey building. A SIGN reads: "NATHANIEL'S INSTITUTE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching Agatha. She heads up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha enters. She heads to the ELEVATORS. Presses up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PEOPLE follow Agatha in. One presses 2, the other 3. Agatha presses 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha checks the floorplan. Turns to her left. She stops a door: "DR. SIRIUS LEARY, M.D. EXPERIMENTAL PSYCHIATRY." She takes a CARD KEY from THE WALLET and swipes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wall to wall books. Agatha hovers in the entranceway, her eyes sweeping the room. She turns to the FILING CABINETS. Searches them.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hangs up the HALLWAY phone and turns to Robin.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Why hasn‚Äôt mom called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha closes the last filing cabinet. She looks around, desperate. Sees a SIDE DOOR. She turns the handle..The door swings open, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: A LABORATORY
dialogues.text: with a kind of DENTIST'S CHAIR in the center. Beside it i an INSTRUMENT TRAY with an ARRAY OF SCALPELS and an UNUSU DRILL-LIKE TOOL. Agatha steers clear of the chair. She's drawn towards a T STEEL CUPBOARD. It's PADLOCKED. She picks up the DRILL an SHATTERS the lock. The door CREAKS open.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA'S FACE
dialogues.text: pales. Suddenly, a SHADOW falls over her from the DOORWAY. She spins around... GASPS... her hand shooting to her mou It's ISAAC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits in his chair, comatose. Robin sits across from him, gazing at the book. He picks a pen. Opens to PAGE 1. Starts CIRCLING every twenty thir word: "THE" "I" "Ig" "Op" He stops. Ridiculous idea. Puts the book down. A beat. He picks it up again. Turns to PAGE 23. Does the same thi

dialogues.speaker: UTE" "YOU" "ARE" "READING "THIS" "YOU" "ARE" "ONTO" "ME"
dialogues.text: Robin's mouth falis open. The pen drops from his grasp. W hear HIS HEARTBEAT -- getting faster... and faster...  97. Walter looks at him. Robin opens his mouth, but nothing c out. Walter takes the book, sees the circled words.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: (raspy) Every twenty-third word. Walter reads the words. His face changes. He picks up the pen. Continues on from his son:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: "I" "warn" "you" "continue" "at" "your" "peril" "you" "do" "not" "want" "to" "find" "me" He continues, but gets gibberish. The next page is the sa

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Twenty three words. It's every twenty- third word, twenty three times, on page 23. A beat. Walter flicks ahead to PAGE 46. Tries again:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: "you'll" "regret"¬Æ "this" "you" "fool" "trust" "me" "once" "you" "learn" "the" "truth" "there" "can" "be" "no" "turning" "back" "this" "is" "your" "last" "chance" He turns to PAGE 69.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: "very" "well" "visit" "Casanova" "spark" "di beneath" "the" "steps" "to" "heaven" "you'll" "guess" "which" "one" "I" "warn" "you" ‚Äúhell‚Äù "is" "waiting" "sparrow" man‚Äù (a beat) He's talking directly to me. He knows I'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: But who's Casanova Spark, dad? Walter stares at the words, thinking. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Tt's not a person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the house THROUGH THE MYSTERY CAR WINDOW. Walter and Robin exit with TWO SHOVELS. They climb into the truc  98. Suddenly, the POV SHIFTS to that of...

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: from the end of the street. As Walter drives off, Ned tur to the mystery car. It pulls away from the curb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck flashes past a sign for "CASANOVA'S PARK." Seconds later, THE MYSTERY CAR flashes past, its headlamp dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Robin study a MAP DISPLAY of the park's ground

dialogues.speaker: EXT, WOOD
dialogues.text: Walter and Robin trek through with FLASHLIGHTS. They appr a CLEARING.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: a SIGNPOST reads: "THE STEPS TO HEAVEN." Below it, anothe adds: "WARNING: UNSAFE FOOTING. DON'T STRAY OFF THE PATH. Robin shines his light on the STEPPING STONES that disapp through a MARSH into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: How are we gonna guess which one? Walter stares at TWO EYES glinting at him from the shadow quickly recognizing the FAMILIAR SHAPE OF NED. Walter stares at the stones. Takes Robin's hand. They hea across.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: One. Two. Three...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE 23RD STEPPING STONE
dialogues.text: they stop. The stones continue on to a DUCK POND. Walter jams his shovel under the stone and levers it asid He starts to dig.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW FROM THE TREES
dialogues.text: are hard at it and have A LARGE PIT to show for their eff Robin pauses.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Rest up if you need to.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: It's not that. I was just thinking. (glances about) What if mom was right? What if that man wasn't the author? What if he was only the guy's publisher or something?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Sounds like a lot of what ifs.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: But wouldn't it mean the real killer is still out there? Robin succeeds in spooking his dad. Walter stops digging, picks up a flashlight and shines it about. Suddenly... ...WE ARE WATCHING FROM THE TREES AGAIN. We duck behind a trunk as the light sweeps past.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You're beginning to sound like me, kiddo. He bends to put the light down when he freezes. Stares in the pit. The flashlight illuminates

dialogues.speaker: A RIBCAGE
dialogues.text: poking through the soil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Burns and TWO POLICEMEN approach Walter and Robi

dialogues.speaker: EXT, CASANOVA'S PARK
dialogues.text: Walter and Robin lead them across THE STEPS TO HEAVEN. Their pace slows near the 23rd stone. Father and son glan about -- frowning mirror images of each other. Their pit. ...-HAS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: SEVERAL HOURS LATER
dialogues.text: have been dug under various stones. Three pairs of very p eyes are on Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter paces. Robin sits, studying his surroundings, stud things... things like the numbers on OFFICERS' UNIFORMS..

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What's taking your Mom so long? He tenses... his face drains of color...

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: talks, MOS, to Sergeant Burns. Isaac sees Walter staring. Isaac doesn't smile. Suddenly. .. Agatha steps out from a doorway. She sees Walter, speaks to the Sergeant, and approaches h family.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: I've come to take you home,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha converses with Isaac, MOS.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: watching out the truck window. Agatha pecks Isaac on the Isaac glances at Walter, then walks to HIS CAR (the myste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIGHT RAIN is just beginning. Walter drives. Agatha is quiet. Robin is losing it.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Skeletons don't just get up and walk away, mom. You were right, that old man wasn't the killer. The killer's still out there and he knows dad's onto him, I found all these secret messages in the book. Every twenty- third word--  101.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: {to Walter) How could you let him read it?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: He didn‚Äôt.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: But you just said... She flicks through the book, stopping at the CIRCLED WORD

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: How did you know to do this? A beat. Walter looks at Robin.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Listen to me. Both of you. Twenty three is a number. A god damn number. There's no curse. There's no killer running around out there. {to Walter) You are not going to kill me. You love me. You always have. You always will. The old man is dead. The book is history. And it's over. Over. Silence. Walter turns a corner, HITS HIS BRAKES immediately. Ned sits directly in his path.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: The Guardian of the Dead. Walter glances at Robin in the rearview mirror, then Agat Suddenly he STEPS ON THE GAS. Ned doesn't flinch, doesn't even bat an eye, not even when he SLAMS INTO, and OVER HI Fifty yards on he stops. Checks his rearview mirror. Shad and raindrops render his view unrewarding. He turns to Ag

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Nasty. Evil. Dead. Dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is in bed. Agatha draws the curtains. It's raining harder.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: It was there, Mom. She kisses him and leaves. As soon as the door closes, Ro gets up and starts covering his walls with WHITE PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits at the table, munching on a SLICE OF APPLE. The door opens. Agatha enters. Walter picks up a KNIFE. C another slice of apple. Agatha stares at the knife. Takes it from him. She sits opposite and cuts the apple for him, sliding each perfect cut segment slowly across the table.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Why was Isaac with you?

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: He was concerned about me. Isaac is my friend. Walter's eyes are drawn to her hands... her fingernails.. her MUD-CAKED FINGERNAILS. She follows his gaze, quickly curls her fingers up. Takes the knife to the sink. Scrubs her hands. Her back is to h

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Don't do this. Please.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You moved the skeleton. But how... unless... He flips open a PAD. Writes "AGATHA FRANCESCA SPARROW." I equals 38/70/110. 38=11, 70=7, 110=2. 11+7+2 is... 20? He stares at the numbers in frustration. Crumples the pap in his fist. Notices his wedding ring and... ...tries again, but this time with "AGATHA FRANCESCA PINK

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Twenty three.  103. Desperate, he tries another method: 38+70+50=158; 15+8 is

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Any way I do it, it's twenty-fucking- three. FLASHCUT: THE OLD TYPEWRITER -- THE 2S AND 3S WORN AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Dear God...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You had access to my trunk. You...

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Please don't. I beg you.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You're Topsy Kretts?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You wrote it. Which means... Agatha faces him, tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Don't make me do this. His eyes lower to her hands... and the knife she still ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are plastered in paper. Robin scribbles BIZARRE FACTS on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at the knife.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You've been pulling the strings all along.  104.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: No. That‚Äôs not true, sweetie. Just let it be.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: All this time, I feared I was going to kill you, when really--

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: --stop it. Please, stop it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I will. Just hand me the knife.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: No. I can't do that. Walter glances at the KNIFE BLOCK: two empty slots but st four more knives available. That is, until... ...Agatha pulls it towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin stares at his walls. He exits his room and heads to the STAIRCASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter backs away from the table, scanning the room.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Why would you do this to me? I love you so much.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Do you? Do you really? Is it really me that you love? Walter notices AGATHA‚ÄôS BAG on the counter. SOMETHING ODD pokes out. He inches his way to it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I've always loved you. My whole life started with you. He reaches into the bag and... pulls out THE KNIFE.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin reaches the bottom step and turns to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table separates Agatha and Walter. Both hold knives.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: I took it when we went to meet that man. The one you said you didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: The one who died when I left you with him. Walter looks around. Everywhere he looks, he sees 23... e the RAINDROPS ON THE WINDOW seem to be in on it... Agatha follows his gaze... realizes...

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Put the knife down, Walter. You're scaring me. Don‚Äôt you see? You're making the book come true. The numbers start to GLOW... to MOVE... as if trying to B FREE OF THEIR BONDS. All of a sudden... ...the door OPENS, Robin enters. THE NUMBERS VANISH. Robi freezes. He's between the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Mom? Dad?

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Come to me, Robin. Keep away from your father.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Don't listen to her, son. Come here. To me.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: No! Whatever he says, don't go to him.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: She's Topsy Kretts. She‚Äôs the author. He shows Robin the pad. Robin stares at the big fat 23.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: It's not true. Don't listen to him. She puts her knife down.  106.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: See? Now your father will put his down. Walter? Honey? Walter looks about the room again. The numbers HAVE RETUR

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Put the knife down. You're scaring Robin. Robin! Robin is inching towards Walter, his eyes following his d from place to place... and number to number...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Tell him the truth. Tell him how you took the skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: Yes. I took the skeleton. Robin stops.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: And I'd do it again if I had to. But - I'm not the author.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: She's lying.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: {to Walter) Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Who wrote the book, mom? Do you know?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Tell him. Tell him the truth!

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Mom? A tear falls from Agatha's eye. She looks from Robin to W and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: You did. A long... mind-fucking... beat.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: You wrote it, Walter. You did.  107. Every line, every furrow on Walter's face comes into play Agatha opens the PANTRY and lifts out a BOX. She puts it the table. Robin opens it, takes out an old manus¬¢ript: "THE NUMBER 23, BY WALTER PAUL SPARROW.‚Äù

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You typed this. You put my name on it. Walter flinches as Agatha steps forward. She removes the cover page, revealing the followin rawl in handwritin

dialogues.speaker: "TQ SIRIUS, IN EXCHANGE FOR MY NIGHTMARES, WALTER, XXX."
dialogues.text: She offers him a PEN. He doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No. No. You‚Äôre lying. She's lying. Robin moves to his mom's side. She brings in ANOTHER BOX. Takes off the lid and pulls out a SAXOPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: LABORATORY CUPBOARD.
dialogues.text: She offers it to Walter. He stares at it. The horn end is badly dented. He puts down the knife, reaches out and tak it from her. Odd, his fingers seem to slip into place. He puts it to his lips and... ...PLAYS. Brilliantly. VERY SLOWLY, ALL THE TWENTY-THREES IN THE ROOM FADE AWAY. Agatha takes Robin's hand. Tears stream down their cheeks Walter stops. Lowers the sax.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I can play. He picks up the book.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It is me, In his other hand, he takes a KNIFE. Looks at it. Studies his REFLECTION in the blade and... BECOMES FINGERLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... FLASHCUT: A CRAZED WALTER SLASHES AT LAURA WITH A KNIFE.  108. The knife FALLS from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I killed her. He overturns a box. PSYCHIATRIC FILES, NEWSPAPER CLIPPING PHOTOS, MEMENTOS, etc, spill out. He stares at them, not comprehending. Silence. Walter moves to the phone. Dials 911. It RINGS. Once. Twi

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: No. Robin cuts him off, tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Either do I, son. He takes Robin's fingers off the hook. Robin wraps his ar around him. Walter kisses him on the head, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I love you so much.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: What's gonna happen to me without you? He looks at his mom, eyes pleading. A beat. Agatha walks Walter... takes the phone from him...

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: You said, your whole life started with me. Well, my life began with you, Walter. And it's not going to end here. I don't know what happened to you, but I do know this: you weren't a bad man who got better. You were a sick man who got well. Very well. She hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: There's an innocent man in prison, Ag.  109.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: And he's lost everything. Nothing we do will change that, but it will change what we have. She picks up his FOTY mug.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: You're a wonderful husband and the best father a son could ever have. Robin hugs his dad, tight.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: And I love you. She embraces her family. The doorbell RINGS. The Sparrows part. Worried looks are exchanged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha and Robin watch, hand in hand, as Walter opens the FRONT DOOR. It's Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I... I wanted to check... Walter steps aside. Isaac sees Agatha and sighs with reli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha, Robin and Isaac enter. Isaac sees the BOXES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at himself in the BATHROOM MIRROR. He EXITS, trudges past ROBIN'‚ÄôS ROOM (the door is open). pauses. Backtracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter steps in. Stares at the walls. A PAD on the desk draws his attention. It‚Äôs the pad Robin had in the truck and on it Walter sees "ROBIN WILBERFORCE SPARROW" and the numbers 58/116/110 or 13/8/2 or... 23. Walter looks at the walls again. He starts to shake.  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha, Robin and Isaac sit at the table. Isaac goes to h Agatha's hand. She shies away. The front door SLAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha stands in the open front doorway. Robin runs down stairs and hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Where's he gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter shuffles along, aimless, He stops. He's at the University.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at a CAR PARK. He looks around. STUDENTS mi about. When he turns back to the car park... ...IT HAS BEEN REPLACED BY A LAWN. There's a CROWD on it. the center:

dialogues.speaker: 22-YR-OLD WALTER
dialogues.text: plays the sax. He finishes up and works the crowd with a HAT, people dropping coins in then drifting off. He ends a YOUNG WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: I've heard it's ali in the tongue. She wiggles her tongue seductively, drops SOMETHING into hat and walks off. Walter examines her ‚Äòdonation‚Äô -- A PI OF PAPER with the name "LAURA TOLLINS" and PHONE NUMBER.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: walks away from the lawn... and it becomes a car park onc more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha puts the phone down. Hugs Robin. She looks at Isaac -- the contents of the boxes spread ov the coffee table in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Does he remember anything?  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits on a bench. The following come fast and furio PLASHCUT: WALTER AND LAURA, HAND IN HAND. FLASHCUT: WALTER BUYS AN ENGAGEMENT RING.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: flow freely down Walter's cheeks. He rises. Walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter trudges along, gazing at SHOP WINDOWS.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUT
dialogues.text: Walter stops in front of the HARDWARE STORE. The KNIFE ha gone. Suddenly there's LAUGHTER. LAURA AND KYLE exit the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at the WALLS. Suddenly, they BECOME PINK... the sky DARKENS... EVENING rolls in... ...bringing with it A BATTERED OLD CAR, coasting up, headlights off. YOUNG WALTER gets out. He looks around furtively then climbs through an OPEN WINDOW. ‚ÄòWalter closes his eyes and we...

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: LIGHT appears. Odd, it's SLATTED... +..as though we are LOOKING THROUGH A CLOSED CLOSET DOOR FROM THE INSIDE. Laura appears. She begins undressing.  112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's eyes burst open, fixate on the MAIN DOORS. The s darken more. It's NIGHT. ‚ÄòHe' exits (aged 23). He has a PLASTIC BAG with him. He scurries towards an EXPENSIVE LINCOLN SUV. Climbs onto its foot ledge as... the SUV morphs into a DUMPSTER. There's a CLANG as Young Walter empties the bag inside. H runs back inside the building. Walter looks at the BATTERED OLD CAR. Walks to it. Reache out and pops the trunk. It's empty. Suddenly, Young Walter appears by his side with LAURA'S BLOODSTAINED BODY in arms. He dumps her in the TRUNK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits in a pew, not praying, but watching a MAN at front who is. The Man rises. Walks up the aisle. It's KYLE FLINCH. He pauses, seems to look right at Walter, Walter mouths the words "I'M SORRY" then, puzzled, turns around. POLICEMEN block the doors behind him.

dialogues.speaker: INT, LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Isaac studies a file.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: It seems he suffered from--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at Laura's grave.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --terrible nightmares. He turns to leave and is confronted by DEAD, BLOOD-STAINE LAURA. She dances around him, repeating "TWENTY THREE" ov and over and over... Walter clamps his hands over his ears.  113.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: That's why he never finished college.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: But I thought... his parents' death... Isaac cross-checks files.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: No, it looks like he'd already dropped out by the time they died. And he'd already met Dr. Leary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands across the street, staring at the tall, gre monolith. He crosses over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands frozen in the ENTRANCE LOBBY. The RECEPTION is a woman with grey hair.

dialogues.speaker: RED HAIR AND LESS LINES ON HER FACE.
dialogues.text: Walter walks down a corridor to the elevators, Presses up

dialogues.speaker: INT, 18TH FLOOR CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Walter exits the elevator. Turns to his left.

dialogues.speaker: WALLPAPER, DIFFERENT CARPET, ETC.
dialogues.text: Walter stops by Dr. Leary'‚Äôs door. Stares at the nameplat The door opens. A CLEANING LADY comes out. She's been cry She looks at Walter.

dialogues.speaker: CLEANING LADY
dialogues.text: Terrible, isn't it? She leaves the door open for him. Walter sways in the doo As_his eyes swee) he room, little things change: the daffodils in the vase become irises, photos on the ke vanish, various books disappear, get newer, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
