dialogues.text: Isaac frowns, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: He confessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter (present-day) sits in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I killed her. I stabbed her 23 times. Suddenly, a younger Dr. Leary materializes in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SIRIUS LEARY
dialogues.text: The feelings you're experiencing are only natural.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SIRIUS LEARY
dialogues.text: You blame yourself for her death. It's called misappropriated guilt.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, I killed her!

dialogues.speaker: DR. SIRIUS LEARY
dialogues.text: You believe you drove her, through your obsession, into the arms of another man, a man who turned out to be a vicious killer. In your eyes, yes, you killed her, but the real killer is in prison. Walter sinks his head. When he lifts it again, he is Youn Walter.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Tell me how to stop the nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac continues.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: He told Walter he needed a hobby, a distraction, something to give his days meaning. He refused to even touch a saxophone. The only thing he talked fondly of was books. Agatha smiles a weak smile.  115.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Reading 'Fingerling at the Zoo‚Äô was one of his earliest memories. At one session he announced--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter gazes out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: --I'm going to write a book. In the distance is a PINK NEON SIGN. It says "_HELL HOTEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Walter sits at the bureau tapping away on A TYPEWRI He leans out, writes on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It took him 23 days. Dr. Leary thought it was-- INT. DR. SIRIUS LEARY'‚ÄôS OFFICE - DAY Walter watches Dr. Leary turn over the last page.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SIRIUS LEARY
dialogues.text: Brilliant!

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He believed Walter was purging his undeserved guilt on the page. He told him to--

dialogues.speaker: DR. SIRIUS LEARY
dialogues.text: Publish it!

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --thinking it would kick-start a new life. But Walter had written it to try and end his nightmares... Dead, blood-stained Laura WHISPERS "23" to Walter, her to probing the inside of his ear drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha stares at the MANUSCRIPT.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: He refused to have anything more to do with it and viewed all hobbies as pointless.  116. Agatha looks at Walter's BIRTHDAY PRESENTS in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: How did he forget?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Dr. Leary said there was a way to stop his nightmares. But it was an experimental procedure--

dialogues.speaker: INT, DR. SIRIUS LEARY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Walter opens the door to Dr. Leary's LABORATORY. He sees younger self sitting in the chair. The drill-like tool rests on the instrument tray, BLOODY. TUBE sticks out of the side of Walter's head. SEVERAL WIR run into it. Dr. Leary sits at a monitor studying a 3-D image of the b

dialogues.speaker: DR. SIRIUS LEARY
dialogues.text: Think of Laura. A part of the brain GLOWS. Dr. Leary flips a switch and a BOLT OF ELECTRICITY shoots down the wire and into young Walter's skull. Present-day Walter clutches his head.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: --and one hundred percent irreversible. The image on the monitor STOPS FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Or so he thought. Walter takes his hand from the side of his head. It's BLO He starts to BREATHE FAST... the room SWIRLS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stumbles out of Dr. Leary's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter flees down the steps...

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Dr. Leary published it, didn't he? He changed the name as a precaution.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Yes. The rest--  117.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: --I know. ...spinning back to them at the bottom. A YOUNG MAN is following him down. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: IN CAKE.
dialogues.text: Walter screams, a WILD, BLOODCURDLING SCREAM:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Noooco00000-- He stops, cut_off in his prime. A DOG stares at him from the road. It has black, bottomless eyes anda silver colla

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What do you want from me! Ned walks to the end of the street. Walter follows. Ned barks at a wall. Walter freezes.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No. No! GRAFFITI reads: "LIKE FATHER LIKE SON."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I have to speak to Sergeant Burns!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Burns stares at Walter. Odd, he now has DARK RIN under his eyes. He stares at Walter, impassive.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I know it's hard to believe, but please, you have to.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT BURNS
dialogues.text: Twenty three is just a number.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No--

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT BURNS
dialogues.text: --yes! Your wife telephoned. She said you might pay us a visit.  118.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Agatha called you? But, wait, no, she... she doesn't understand--

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT BURNS
dialogues.text: Then we'll ask her when she arrives.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: She's coming? No. You don't know what you've done. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT BURNS
dialogues.text: Mr. Sparrow! It‚Äôs just a number! Sergeant Burns sighs. He gazes at HIS WIFE's PHOTO, then slides a PIECE OF PAPER out from a stack. On it are VARIO SCRIBBLES -- WORDS AND NUMBERS. In the middle is the name "CROMWELL JOSEPH BURNS‚Äù ..,and its value... 101/73/74... 2/10/11... TWENTY THREE. Sergeant Burns stares at the photo.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Just a God damn lousy number.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: Walter exits. Ned waits for him.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as destiny. There are only different choices. There's a HONK. Agatha, Robin and Isaac pull up in his tr down the street. Walter looks at Ned. A BIRD suddenly CRASHES into a windo and drops to the ground. Walter flips it over with his fo It has a red breast. Robin clambers out of the truck. Starts running towards h Walter looks up and down the street. 2S AND 3S EVERYWHERE START TO SPARKLE. And then a BUS TURNS THE CORNER... -a No. 23.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Was the number just a number, or was it evil? Was Ned just a dog, or was he truly 'The Guardian of the Dead'?  119. Walter looks at Robin... at Agatha... at Ned... beside wh now stands THE VISION OF SUICIDE GAL.

dialogues.speaker: SUICIDE GAL
dialogues.text: I guess he just didn't love me enough.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Finally, I understood. I had written the rules. It was time for me to play by them. Walter turns to the now FAST-APPROACHING bus. Gazes at Ag She locks eyes with him. He mouths:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'll never forget you. He walks down the steps, continuing right off the curb. B SQUEAL and... THE SCREEN TURNS RED. ODD... ¬ª..it seems alive. Moving. Flowing.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: You can call me Fingerling. Walter lies on his back in the middle of the cobblestoned road, staring at the BLOOD seeping from his head.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's not my real name, but comes from a book I read as a child, 'Fingerling at the Zoo.‚Äô

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large funeral crowd. No one we recognize. The name on t NEW gravestone reads: "LAURA TOLLINS.‚Äù

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Paper flap long gone, it had a green, hardback cover and mottled texture, and was possibly my very first book. We pull away and, CAMERA ABOUT KNEE-HIGH, weave across th grounds, past the graves of SIRIUS LEARY... JESSICA FLINC

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Funny, I can't recall what it was about, the only thing I remember is the name. 'Fingerling.' I wished it was mine.  120.

dialogues.speaker: NOT FAR AWAY
dialogues.text: stand by a GRAVESTONE. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Now it is. A MAN walks up beside them. Looks at the gravestone.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It wasn't the happiest of endings. But justice. was served. The man faces them. It's Kyle Flinch.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE FLINCH
dialogues.text: Thank you. He walks away to an ELDERLY MAN AND WOMAN -- his parents. Agatha takes Robin's hand. She turns to leave, sees:

dialogues.speaker: NOT FAR AWAY
dialogues.text: sitting under a tree, watching them.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: While I don't particularly like the choice I had to make... Robin follows his mom's gaze. Ned looks him in the eye th glances around the cemetery. Robin does the same. 2S AND ON_ GRAVES SUDDENLY... ...SPARKLE IN THE SUNLIGHT. And Robin is seeing them.

dialogues.speaker: AGATHA
dialogues.text: What is it? Robin looks at his mom, He turns back to the graves.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: ...I know I made the right one... ALL THE NUMBERS FADE AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Nothing, mom. It's nothing. Ned walks off.  121. Agatha and Robin set off in the opposite direction to a c Isaac's car.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ..-and from where I am now, it makes perfect sense. We PULL UP, INTO THE SKY, until we are LOOKING DOWN ON TH GRAVEYARD FROM A GREAT HEIGHT. Various locations STAND OU the bookstore, Nathaniel's, the Sparrow home, Casanova's Park, the Shell Hotel, police station, etc. Weird. If you join the dots between all of them, you end with a number... = FADE OUT. The following TITLECARD appears:

dialogues.speaker: "BE SURE YOUR SIN WILL FIND YOU OUT."
